alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 04 at 11:18PM EDT until April 06 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN EXPECTED WEDNESDAY INTO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... .Cooler air arriving tonight will allow a spring storm system to bring a mix of wintry precipitation, mainly in the form of freezing rain and sleet. Precipitation will onset Wednesday, with the bulk of sleet and freezing rain falling north of the mountains. Come Wednesday evening, these chances improve into the foothills and interior locations where some slick conditions may last into early Thursday morning. Temperatures are forecast to rise above freezing rapidly Thursday morning, bringing an end to freezing precipitation. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM WEDNESDAY TO 8 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to two inches, sleet accumulations around 1 inch and ice accumulations between one tenth and four tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 11 AM Wednesday to 8 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions. A period of mixed precipitation is expected with air temperatures remaining below freezing. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
